skill.name: modern-javascript-patterns
skill.description: Master ES6+ features including async/await, destructuring, spread operators, arrow functions, promises, modules, iterators, generators, and functional programming patterns for writing clean, efficient JavaScript code. Use when refactoring legacy code, implementing modern patterns, or optimizing JavaScript applications.
skill.summary: Master ES6+ features including async/await, destructuring, spread operators, arrow functions, promis...

security_audit.summary: Scanned one Markdown skill file with instructional JavaScript examples. No file access, network calls, or execution logic is present.

content.value_statement: Legacy code and async logic can be hard to maintain. This skill guides you to modern syntax and patterns with clear examples.
actual_capabilities: Explain arrow functions, destructuring, and spread usage with examples
Show Promise combinators and async and await control flow
Demonstrate functional patterns like map, filter, reduce, and compose
Outline class fields, private members, and inheritance patterns
Describe modules, dynamic imports, iterators, and generators
limitations: Does not run or modify code in your repository
Does not infer project specific conventions without input
Does not provide framework specific patterns beyond core JavaScript
Does not validate performance changes with benchmarks

use_cases.title: Refactor legacy UI code
use_cases.description: Translate callbacks and old syntax into modern ES6 patterns with clear steps.

use_cases.title: Improve async flows
use_cases.description: Choose the right Promise combinators and async patterns for clean data flows.

use_cases.title: Standardize code style
use_cases.description: Create team guidelines for modern JavaScript and functional techniques.

prompt_templates.title: Modernize a function
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this function using ES6 features and explain each change: [paste function].

prompt_templates.title: Async error handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this Promise chain to async and await with proper error handling: [paste chain].

prompt_templates.title: Functional pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a map, filter, reduce pipeline for this data and explain why it is pure: [data].

prompt_templates.title: Performance patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to add debounce or throttle to this handler and explain tradeoffs: [handler].

output_examples.input: Refactor this callback based fetch to async and await and list key benefits.
output: Converted nested callbacks to async and await for readability
Added try and catch for consistent error handling
Separated data parsing into a small helper function

best_practices: Provide the original code and target runtime version
Ask for a brief explanation of tradeoffs when changing patterns
Validate async flows with clear error handling requirements
anti_patterns: Requesting a rewrite without sharing any code
Asking to access secrets or local files
Demanding framework specific guidance without naming the framework

faq.question: Is this compatible with Node.js and browsers?
faq.answer: Yes, it covers ES6 and later features and notes patterns usable in both environments.

faq.question: What are the limits of the guidance?
faq.answer: It provides examples and patterns but does not execute or verify changes in your codebase.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my coding workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, paste your code and request refactoring guidance or pattern explanations.

faq.question: Does it access my data or environment?
faq.answer: No, it only responds to the text you provide.

faq.question: What if the suggested pattern does not work?
faq.answer: Share the error and runtime details for a revised recommendation.

faq.question: How does it compare to general JavaScript help?
faq.answer: It focuses on modern patterns, async flows, and functional style with practical examples.
